name: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
author: Progresso
summary: Here's a rich soup for an autumn day--winter squash is roasted and pureed and blended into a creamy broth  seasoned with cinnamon and roasted coriander.
ingredients: 2 cups raw winter squash (butternut, hubbard, acorn)
Sea salt and freshly ground pepper
½ cup Progresso® plain Panko crispy bread crumbs, toasted light brown in saute pan over medium heat
directions: To make roasted  : Heat oven to 375 degrees F
Heat butter over medium-high heat in an ovenproof saute pan; add diced squash, salt and pepper
When squash begins to brown, place pan in oven
Roast for 15 minutes or until medium-brown on all sides
Remove from oven and let cool slightly
Puree in food processor, or mash with potato masher or ricer
Measure 1 1/2 cups squash; reserve
To make soup: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat until hot
Add the onion, celery, carrot and cinnamon stick; saute until soft but not brown, about 10 minutes
Season with salt and pepper
Add the broth and the coriander; bring to a boil
Simmer for several minutes
Stir in reserved squash until smooth; simmer gently to let the flavors meld, about 10 minutes
Discard the cinnamon stick
Puree the soup using an immersion blender or in a blender until smooth
(The soup can be made ahead to this point, cooled, covered, and refrigerated for several days or frozen for about 1 month
It will thicken as it cools and may need thinning with broth or water when reheating
) Return the soup to the pan and reheat gently
Add the half-and-half
Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper
Top each serving with pumpkin seeds and toasted bread crumbs
